data.title: Beautiful Architecture
data.text: My review is just about the beauty of this place. I recommend history buff tourists to stop in and see the beautiful interior and check out the restaurant too!

data.title: Great place to pay a parking fine
data.text: I paid my parking ticket here once. I also get to sue tenants that owe us money. Heads up, they have a metal detector, so leave your shives in the car!

data.title: Albany City Hall
data.text:
Cool place 
Open area for sightseeing 
Nice meeting place
It was beautiful to see it 
Near the other monuments

data.title: A real Jam - worth a detour
data.text: There are not many things to see in Albany but the City Hall is a building that is woths a detour. A splendid staircade, wonderful court rooms and a very intersting and unique architecture. If you are somewhere near, go and see it.

data.title: Worth a visit when in the downtown area.
data.text: Combine this with a visit to downtown as it will only take a short while to visit.  The architecture is beautiful, each floor has some art to view ( ie paintings).

data.title: City Hall awesome edifice!
data.text: this edifice has beautiful court rooms and the tower has a carillon that plays at noon time.  It is a must see building while in Albany. Please note due to it being a city hall. You must go through a metal detector.

data.title: This is a true hall of Justice
data.text: I have searched real estate records here, filed divorce papers here, represented clients here, served jury duty here and had a great lunch here. The building is ancient and its history is worth learning. Bustling during the work week, I don't even know if you can get into the building on the weekend. A famous Dutch historic landmark.

data.title: Richardson's Masterpiece
data.text: H.H. Richardson's best work in the Romanesque style, finished in 1883.  Exterior detail is stunning and features many perfectly proportioned arches.  Interior characterized by lots of wood finishes, including a wooden revolving entry door.  Hasn't changed much in over 100 years (except for security hardware).  Kind of like entering a time machine.  As a public building, anyone can walk in to enjoy the lush space and elegant stairway leading to upper floors.  Located just downhill from the State government buildings.

data.title: Great old building.
data.text: Pay a water bill, your taxes or a fine; check the tax rolls when they re-assess (but expect no help from the staff); go to a Common Council session; visit the Mayor. There's not a lot to see at City Hall, but it's a wonderful building. It's designed by HH Richardson, one of the leading 19th century architects, who also helped design the state capital across the street.

data.title: Castle city Hall
data.text: Worth seeing, beautiful building inside and out.  Must see are the hand carved stairway that tells a story in pictures on each floor and the Celine in the WarRoom! Old tiles that were very interesting too. You will have to go through security to get tho', but no problem.  Eve

data.title: Interesting historic building
data.text: Albany City Hall is an interesting historic building that is worth a short visit. This is good stop to work into a walking tour of the downtown area. There are paintings on various floors to view, in addition to the architectural elements.

data.title: Architectural Masterpiece
data.text: If you are in Albany, be sure to at least look at the outside of City Hall.  It represents H.H. Richardson at his best in his Richardson Romanesque style with various colors of granite around the arched entrance and the stunning bell tower.  Inside is rather plain and you have to pass through security, so only real architecture nerds would appreciate it.  Richardson used most of his energy (and Albany’s money) on the outside.   The inside has more in common with the Allegheny County Court House in Pittsburgh with an open light court in the middle (just a much smaller version).  There are a few paintings and murals, but it is not nearly as elaborate as the state capitol across the street.

data.title: Original architecture with modern views....
data.text:
Truly gem and if you are into old structures, I encourage to visit.
I loved visiting this building.  I think I was more excited to ride in their period elevator.

data.title: Albany architecture...
data.text:
Albany offers many pretty nice and interesting buildings... City Hall is one of them. 
Across from the NY State Capitol, this architecture is typical of NY State buildings of this era.
Also take a peak Inside...

data.title: An Architectural Delight
data.text: A wonderful experience for someone who likes architecture. Richardson is the architect. A well designed building!

data.title: visit to city hall
data.text: beautiful building in downtown albany.we visited the tax office and stall was very friedly and helpful.

data.title: Change is Good
data.text: Building has limitations due to its design and age however new administration uses the Rotunda more frequently for public events and displays.

data.title: Take a walk in this area
data.text: Nice architecture. Romanesque design. Very well preserved. Facing the State Capitol and just a few blocks away from the Egg. You should take a walk in this area. Must see.

data.title: no longer in business
data.text: You knew they no longer do business right? they were great while they were there but they are gone! We enjoyed them while they were there to give us a historical tour.

data.title: Beautiful Architecture
data.text: Albany has many amazing examples of different periods and techniques of architecture.  City Hall is beautiful and it is unusual by the fact that it has real bells in its bell tower which do function and can be heard at certain times.  There is nothing really to DO at city all aside from walk around and inside to observe the structure.
